intro: Kageneckia lanceolata angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kageneckia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrow and elongated. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions in Asia, particularly China, and thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
